content.question: An experimenter conducted a two-tailed hypothesis test on a set of data and obtained a p-value of 0.44. If the experimenter had conducted a one-tailed test on the same set of data, which of the following is true about the possible p-value(s) that the experimenter could have obtained?

skill.text: Skill 4.B: Interpret statistical calculations and findings to assign meaning or assess a claim.
